tuv.seg: Crowd control at public events in Ireland
Rialú sluaite ag imeachtaí poiblí in Éirinn
Every year many concerts, festivals, public meetings and major events take place in Ireland
Gach bliain bíonn go leor ceolchoirmeacha, féilte, cruinnithe poiblí agus imeachtaí móra ar siúl in Éirinn
Article 40 of Bunreacht na hEireann (the Irish Constitution) guarantees your right to assemble or meet peacefully and without weapons
Tugann Airteagal 40 de Bhunreacht na hÉireann ráthaíocht go bhfuil sé de cheart agat bailiú le chéile nó bualadh le chéile go síochánta agus gan airm
This right is limited by legislation to protect public order and morality
Cuireann reachtaíocht srian leis an gceart seo chun ord poiblí agus moráltacht a chosaint
The law as discussed below prevents or controls meetings that are calculated or designed to cause a riot or breach of the peace
Cuireann an dlí a phléitear thíos cosc ar nó rialaíonn sé cruinnithe atá eagraithe nó deartha chun círéib nó briseadh síochána a chúiseamh
There is more information about these public order offences here
Tá níos mó faisnéise faoi na cionta oird phoiblí seo ar fáil anseo
The purpose of crowd control at public events is to maintain public peace and order and ensure the safety of all who are gathered there
Is é cuspóir an rialaithe sluaite ag imeachtaí poiblí síocháin phoiblí a chothabháil agus sábháilteacht na ndaoine uile atá bailithe ann a chinntiú
There are laws in place designed to give the Gardai (Irish police force) clear and comprehensive legal powers to deal with crowd control
Tá dlíthe i bhfeidhm a dearadh chun cumhachtaí dlíthiúla soiléire cuimsitheacha a thabhairt do na Gardaí (fórsa póilíní na hÉireann) chun cur ar a gcumas déileáil le rialú sluaite
Part III of the Criminal Justice (Public Order) Act 1994 is the main law on this area and is based on the recommendations of the Hamilton Committee on Public Safety and Crowd Control

Is í Cuid III den Acht um Cheartas Coiriúil (Ord Poiblí) 1994 an dlí príomhúil a bhaineann leis an réimse seo agus tá sé bunaithe ar mholtaí an Choiste Hamilton ar Shábháilteacht Phoiblí agus Rialú Sluaite
That committee was established in the wake of the Hillsborough disaster in the UK in 1989
Bunaíodh an coiste sin i ndiaidh thubaiste Hillsborough sa Ríocht Aontaithe i 1989
Control of access to certain events
Rialú rochtana ar imeachtaí áirithe
Section 21 of the Criminal Justice (Public Order) Act 1994 empowers the Gardai to place barriers on roads up to one mile (1.6 km) from where a particular event is taking place
De réir Alt 21 den Acht um Cheartas Coiriúil (Ord Poiblí) 1994 tá sé de chumhacht ag na Gardaí bacainní a chur ar bhóithre suas le míle amháin (1.6 km) ón áit ina bhfuil imeacht áirithe ar siúl
The decision on the placing of barriers must be made by a Garda who is of Superintendent rank or higher
Ní mór do Gharda ar ghrád Ceannfoirt nó níos airde cinneadh a dhéanamh faoi cá háit a gcuirtear bacainní
When the barriers are in place the Gardai are allowed to prohibit people from crossing or passing the barrier if the person does not have a ticket for the event
Nuair a chuirtear bacainní ann féadann na Gardaí cosc a chur ar dhaoine an bhacainn a thrasnú nó dul thart uirthi mura bhfuil ticéad ag an duine don imeacht
The Garda may also seize any alcohol or disposable drinks containers or any offensive article at the barrier before allowing a person to proceed to the event
Féadann na Gardaí aon alcól nó soithigh dí indiúscartha nó aon ábhar ionsaithe a thógáil ag an mbacainn sula dtugann siad cead do dhuine dul ar aghaidh chuig an imeacht
Section 21 also allows people to pass the barriers if they are going to their home or place of work
De réir Alt 21 tá cead ag daoine dul thar na bacainní má tá siad ag dul abhaile nó go dtí an áit an n-oibríonn siad ann
They may also pass the barriers if they are going to any place in the area of the event if it is for a lawful purpose
Féadann siad dul thar na bacainní freisin má tá siad ag dul chuig aon áit i gceantar na himeachta agus tá cuspóir dleathach leis
Anyone who fails to obey the direction given by a Garda at a barrier will be guilty of an offence and is liable to a class D fine
Beidh aon duine nach gcomhlíonann treoir tugtha ag Garda ag bacainn ciontach i gcion agus dlífear fíneáil aicme D a chur air/uirthi
Surrender and seizure of intoxicating liquor
Tabhairt suas agus gabháil deochanna meisciúla
There are rules in Ireland regarding the serving and sale of alcohol
Tá rialacha in Éirinn maidir le seirbheáil agus díol an alcóil
These rules are set out in the various Intoxicating Liquor Acts
Tá na rialacha seo leagtha amach sna hAchtanna Deochanna Meisciúla éagsúla
There is more about the law on alcohol in Ireland here
Tá níos mó faoin dlí maidir le halcól in Éirinn anseo
The Criminal Justice (Public Order) Act 1994 also gives the Gardai the power to search a person going to an event where a barrier has been erected
De réir an Achta um Cheartas Coiriúil (Ord Poiblí) 1994, tá sé de chumhacht ag na Gardaí freisin duine atá ag dul chuig imeacht a raibh bacainn curtha suas dó a chuardach
These rights are set out in Section 22 of the 1994 Act and allow the Gardai to seize intoxicating liquor or any disposable container or any other article which could be used to cause injury

Leagtar na cearta sin amach in Alt 22 d'Acht 1994 agus tugann sé cead do na Gardaí deoch meisciúil nó aon soitheach indiúscartha nó aon ábhar eile a d'fhéadfaí a úsáid chun gortú a chúiseamh a ghabháil
This law also allows a Garda to refuse to allow someone to proceed to the event where they refuse to surrender or give up the intoxicating liquor, disposable container or other article concerned
Tugann an dlí seo cead do Gharda diúltú le duine dul ar aghaidh chuig an imeacht má dhiúltaíonn siad deoch meisciúil, soitheach indiúscartha nó an t-ábhar eile i gceist a thabhairt suas
The Gardai may also require that you to leave the area in an orderly and peaceful manner
Féadann na Gardaí éileamh ort freisin an ceantar a fhágáil ar bhealach ordúil agus síochánta
If you fail to comply with such a request by the Garda without lawful authority or reasonable excuse then you will be guilty of an offence
Má mhainníonn tú éileamh dá leithéid ó Gharda a chomhlíonadh gan údarás dleathach nó leithscéal réasúnta, ansin tá tú ciontach i gcion
The fine for this offence is a class D fine
Is í an fhíneáil don chion seo fíneáil aicme D
